title: Ticket #4756: condor_status ignores enviromental restrictions on interface usage
description:
The following command (correctly) fails on 8.2.2 but succeeds with 8.3.2: 

$ _CONDOR_NETWORK_INTERFACE=127.0.0.1 _CONDOR_BIND_ALL_INTERFACES=FALSE
./install/bin/condor_status -debug -pool condor.cs.wisc.edu

This happens because configuration from the environment is handled last, after the first time we call init_local_hostname() (which we do in the process of determining $(HOSTNAME)). In 8.3.2, init_local_hostname() caches its results, but the configuration code depends on init_local_hostname() not doing so. (Both versions have code in the other places init_local_hostname() is called to check the cache.)
remarks:
2014-Dec-08 11:09:01 by tlmiller:
The offending commit was 69026141a5bfd2c488090d64d8e6909b4dc3578d, which exists only on the 8.3.2 release branch. Since 8.3.2 was not released before this fix was made, we don't need to document it.
